comments:
I've implemented a view with a tree viewer. The model is created on the fly while the tree is expanded.
It does work well when being used from only one client. 
But when I create a node in one browser, refresh another and then return to the first client to delete a tree node there (refresh the viewer) the javascript error below is displayed.

Could not evaluate javascript response:

TypeError: w has no properties

org.eclipse.swt.EventUtil.suspendEventHandling();var wm = org.eclipse.swt.WidgetManager.getInstance();var w = wm.findWidgetById( "w73" );w.destroy();wm.dispose( "w73" );var w = wm.findWidgetById( "w73" );w.destroy();wm.dispose( "w73" );var w = wm.findWidgetById( "w3" );w.setSpace( 2, 1274, 21, 20 );var w = wm.findWidgetById( "w14" );w.setEnabled( false );qx.ui.core.Widget.flushGlobalQueues();org.eclipse.swt.EventUtil.resumeEventHandling();
Which version of RAP do you use? This sounds to me like multiple clients in one session. This would case both clients to be out of sync with the widget tree on the server.

I'm using 1.0-I20070914.
I've tested this with two different browsers, so I guess there must be two different sessions, since browsers do not share sessions.
Maybe this is caused by the model used for the tree which is static on the server, but it should be no problem.

Markus, it's really hard for us to see where the problem lies. Could you provide a snippet to reproduce this? If this is really a RAP problem we would like to fix this for 1.0 as this could cause many other problems.
I'll try to code a simple example to reproduce this and will attach it.

One extra info:
When adding a UICallback to my tree view I'll get this exception:

Maybe this helps, but I'll also attach an example.

Created an attachment (id=79310)
A view demonstrating the problem

The attached file is a view which implements a simple tree viewer.
To reproduce the problem start a new session expand the tree, and delete a node (using the context menu).
The start another session and try to delete another node.
